abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issues guidelines stating that pregnant women should consider not traveling to Rio de Janeiro for 2016 Olympics because of risk of Zika virus infection; also urges women considering pregnancy, and their partners, to exercise caution if traveling to Brazil for Olympics or Paralympics.
lead_paragraph: Concerns about the spread of the Zika virus led the Centers for Disease Control to issue a new guidance about traveling to the Summer Olympics in August.

headline.main: C.D.C. Urges Pregnant Women to Avoid Rio Games, Citing Concerns Over Zika Virus
headline.print_headline: Avoid Travel to Olympics If Pregnant, U.S. Warns

snippet: Concerns about the spread of the Zika virus led the Centers for Disease Control to issue a new guidance about traveling to the Summer Olympics in August.
